reviewText:
LOVE THIS WATCH! I have a 7 yr old daughter and its been on my mind to get her a phone but without the hassle of telemarketers or just any random person being able to reach her.  This was perfect!
I should mention, the watch works perfectly on 3G network.  After you buy the watch, make sure you get a 3G sim (we got it from Tmobile) that way you have the phone number for the watch.  Once you have that, ONLY then I download recommending the app as its a lot simpler once you have the sim to pair the watch and phone (with app).
I absolutely am in love with this watch - looks great, has softer band compared to other products on the market, shows time, convenient calling features - what else do you need!

I actually have the Watch not an actor from China. LOL. There are a couple of things.
1) It only works on a GSM Network 1900 (Something) so it works well with Tmobile. When I first went to set up the line I had a problem with the Representative understanding that it is NOT a "WEARABLE DEVICE." Wearable devices are ex.. Apple Watch, Samsung Watch, LG G Watch, Pebble. This does not fall in that catagory. It needs a plain PHONE LINE with Talk, Text and Data. Sadly, its gonna cost, but that is another issue.
Once we got that straight, It was up and running perfectly.
2) All DEVICES jump from Tower to Tower. So, all devices are irrelevant in that aspect, but it is your physical location to the towers that determine location. So, for me, it is accurate within 100 Feet of her actual location. But I am in NY amidst Hundreds of towers, so I am more accurate.
3) As of 2017 Tmobile will be be carrying all of ATT's 2G customers. They plan on offering 2G for another year. Also, they carry tons of small wireless companies on their network, that rely on their 2G/ So, that is really not the biggest concern. I contacted QQ Tencent to see if they would be upgrading their product to 3G. They said they would. Only God knows when this will happen and you would have to purchase a new device.
4) The operating instructions are not friendly. But it did go on Youtube prior to purchasing this watch and watched several tutorial videos on how to work the watch.
5) I am looking into other Wireless carriers that run on Tmobiles network, so I can get a cheaper deal on a plan.
Fake

We have two boys (both under 7) and we have been waiting for this product for well frankly... years.

I know there are a lot of contradicting reviews below and many other parents who might be very interested in this product are not sure if they should buy it, so here goes -

In a nutshell (see the details below) - this is an excellent product from a very big Chinese conglomerate but the onboarding (=getting-it-to-work) process is just horrible because it lacks instructions. I would bet that the only people who tested onboarding and wrote the installation manual were engineers and not "normal" parents...

The details...

Pros:
- Feature galore: every feature a (slightly controlling) Parent would wish for such as see their accurate location from an app on your phone, chat, family chat cia voice recording, call your child, listen in on your child environment without them knowing, safe and danger geo zones with alerts, class mode, and more. AND you fully control your child's contacts and device from a far (only approve contacts can call/text or be called/texted)
- Excellent hardware for the price: from packaging to plastic quality, wrist band, everything else feels great and I am usually very sensitive to that
- 2G tech - contrary to the reviews below, the decision to go with the old 2G technology (think phones of the late 90s early 2000s = what the watch's manual refers to as GPRS enabled) is actually very smart because it keeps the price point down, the size of the watch is adequate even for a four-year-old and battery holds longer
- The kids love it. We love it, we can easily reach them

Cons:
- Awful onboarding: the instructions are just horrible and no troubleshooting anywhere!!!! You cannot even understand what the icons on the screen mean (short answer is if you see Xs it is not working) - solution is simple see below
- Minor: must use military time, KG, KM - really minor considering all this watch offers and I am sure they can fix it in future app updates
- Kids will call you non-stop for few days (remember when you got your first phone??), just threaten them with "I will turn on class mode" which you can do from your app
- Support quality TBD but come on Tencent, a China support number for US customers, seriously??

And finally most importantly - Onboarding... Caveat this might change by market:
- Very easy: all you need is an AT&T or T-Mobile sim card that is not for wearables, I repeat: do not get the wearable line eventhough that is what they're going to tell you to get in the store and eventhough it is cheaper and costs only $10. It won't work - this watch needs to be treated as a phone. Pay a bit more ($15 per additional line if you are on AT&T or one of the prepaid plans on T mobile which will cost you $30-$40, maybe you can add a line on T mobile as well for cheaper? I do not know but do not add a wearable line),
- A wearable line will show you reception bars and you will be able the see the associated network (click power then down menu button) but that "X" next to the bars won't go away
- Ask the AT&T or t mobile tech support  to associate a real phone IMEI with your new line - it is very annoying that the watch does not come with such a number, believe me I've looked everywhere. But... the operator tech-support (ask for level two support) should be able to provide you with a fake number. Or... alternatively just take one off an old phone u have it is usually behind the battery (old prepaid phone works as well) and ask the tech support to associate your line with that IMEI number. Contrary to reviews below - any IMEI worked for me and it did not have to be a 2G Phone IMEI.
- Now the "X" should turn into two up and down arrows next to each other, right to the reception bars and you r all set!

Last note - yes AT&T is sun setting 2G support early 2017 so they can shift those radio waves to more advanced offering - in Atlanta, for now, it works great but at some point you may be forced to move to T mobile.

Happy tracking!

Compared to the other products sold on Amazon, this one actually functions pretty well. There are a few caveats that will hopefully be cleared up by a firmware update. Tencent is a not a well known name in the US, but they're a pretty big company in China; hopefully this means the watch will see a firmware update to fix some issues.

My use case may be a bit different than most, I'm not looking to track my child. I wanted to give them a limited use cellphone that they wouldn't forget to bring with them or leave behind.

Pros:
* Activation was easy. I bought a T-Mobile SIM starter kit from the local big box retailer. followed the instructions and had it working in 20 minutes.
* The screen is very bright indoors and easy to read.
* Speaker is loud
* App is easy to use.
* Time, Date, and Weather are all set from the cell network. Once activated on the network, the watch adjusted to my local time.
* Speakerphone is surprisingly good.
* Ringtone is Loud.
* Without calling, battery life is about 8 hours. (Considering what this thing does, I can't really ding it for a short battery life.)
* GPS is pretty accurate outdoors.
* I feel like I'm living in the future.
* My child loves calling me from his watch.
* Kid think its got Pokemon on it.

Cons:
* The watch uses 2G, so in the US your only choice is T-Mobile. Check the coverage map! AT&T is shutting down their 2G network and Verizon doesn't support GSM, so you'll be stuck if you don't have decent T-Mobile coverage.
* Needs a data plan to manage the watch.
* The unit does not appear to be able to receive short code SMS messages, so if you're activating on T-Mobile, you won't be able to use the watch to login into the website to manage your account. I may have to add their short code number to the contact list to allow it. I'll update my review with the results when I get a chance to test it.
* The watch doesn't appear to be able to receive any SMS message sent outside of the QQ Watch app.
* GPS doesn't work indoors, at all.
* Frequently updating the GPS location drains the battery. I set ours to update every 60 minutes.
* Time is in 24 hour format, there appears to be no way to change this.
* Can't change the ringtone.
* Weather temperature is set to Celsius, there appears to be no way to change this to Fahrenheit.
* The QQ Watch app is not available in the US Android Play Store, I had to load it using a QR code. ( I used the Google Goggles app.)
* Only the top of the watch band and the a small part of the case are yellow.
* Not really Pokemon.
summary: Best Wristphone on the market, not so great GPS tracker.

reviewText: This was purchased for my nephew who has autism and had gone missing 4 times in a 2 week span. My sister and I were excited about the features and it seemed the most aesthetically pleasing than other smartwatches we saw on Amazon. When it first came in the mail, we were please with the packaging and it looks just like it did online. That's pretty much where our satisfaction ended. It was a challenge to enter in contact group information and the photo of my nephew always seemed to disappear so it was pointless uploading it again after the third time. I live in the United States and it doesn't give you an option to change the settings from military time to standard time, Celsius to degrees, kilograms to pounds (child's weight), centimeters to feet and inches (for child's height) or meters to miles. But what's most disappointing is it's inability to give me the correct location of my child. Sometimes it's right, but most of the time it's wrong. I tested the SIM card in a cellphone to see if I could get an accurate location from Google Maps and it worked fine. I put the same SIM card back in the smartwatch and it shows me that my nephew is in a lake! Something this expensive shouldn't have this many issues. It's being returned asap.

Lies lies in all the 5 star reviews. If you look carefully the names are of famous actor and actresses. We really wanted it to work. We took it to Tmobile and spent 3 hrs and it would not work at all. For AT&T , why would you go backward on technology to the 2G network that will be obselete by Jan 2017. If I could give it negative star I would do so.
summary: Lies lies Warning do not buy

The interior shorts should be made of same fabric and attach like a true skort (these are more like wearing soft short boy-short underwear attached to a skirt. Skorts used to actually be shorts with an attached skirt. So, when you bend over, you're just looking at shorts, not looking at "underwear" which is what the interior material feels and looks like. When they say "denim"-- they don't mean "jeans" type denim. All of the shorts I got (3 colors) were very thin fabric. I would not order again, simply because of the fabrics used on the inside and outside, and the price. I will try a different brand.

This Dandelion necklace came before the date of promised delivery.  It came packaged in a gift box with another item, and it was also wrapped in a plastic bag for protection.

This is really a cute little necklace, the chain is silver colored, 12 inches long.  At the end of the chain, theres a little round glass bulb that holds a few make a wish dandelion seeds in it.  At the top of the bulb is a matching silver colored dome covering the glass a little bit, and at the O ring that holds the bulb to the chain, there is a little silver charm that says Wish.

I think everyone loves dandelions, even those of us who know they're just weeds.  Just the sheer joy of seeing a little kid blowing the fuzzy seeds away of a round lollypop dandelion while making a wish is always a delight.  With this necklace, the joy of that moment is with you around your neck all the time.

It looks dainty and delicate, but its fun and brings to mind summer filled days with loads of dandelions in the yard. The ability to see the dandelion seeds up close (we used a magnifying glass) made it even more special).

Granted, this isn't the top of the jewelry line, but this necklace would make a great gift for anyone in your life that you want to encourage to dream and wish of good things to come!  I think it is really cute; I love how long the chain is and I think it would be an appropriate gift for a child or a grownup. I love the make a wish dandelion seeds inside, and I think it is really darling!

Rigorous honesty is a personal policy of mine so as a buyer and a reviewer, it is important to me first as a buyer to choose products that I am interested in to help serve myself and my family in some positive way. I also look to the reviews written about the products to help me determine if I want to try something new or something different so when I write a review, I strive to provide information and insight about the product that would interest me and help me make that yes or no decision to purchase it again. All the opinions given, good or bad, are my own. The product is only used by me or someone in my immediate family. I received this product on a promotional discount (or for free) in exchange for my honest review and they are 100% my own opinions. I received no compensation for this review and I am not required to give a positive review. I am also not associated with the seller in any way.
summary: Just Make A Wish with this Dandelion Necklace of Cuteness!

reviewText:
This particular pendant caught my eye because I enjoyed the look of the natural piece of dandelion encased in the clear bubble surrounding it. Unfortunately, the actual product I received wasn't quite like the ones in the product photos.

The pendant is a rounded shape and around 2 centimeters deep and across and around 2.25 centimeters high. But let's be clear: this is not an expensive, high-end necklace, and I wasn't expecting it to be one. While the exact materials aren't listed on the product page, it looks as if it's made out of some type of alloy metal with a silver-like appearance and plastic. The pendant comes on a thin chain with lobster clasp at the end. The chain included with the set matches the one shown in the photos, but the first one I received was broken.

The central core of the pendant appears to be clear plastic encased around two dandelion seeds. Unfortunately, the first one I received is quite dirty on the inside, and the outside is scuffed all the way around. The seller later sent a replacement that looks nicer than the first one (the chain wasn't broken and the inside wasn't dirty on the pendant), but there is only one seed inside so it's very difficult to see there's even anything inside, and definitely doesn't look as full inside as the product photos. The first six photos are from the original necklace, and the three ones after that are of the second necklace. Unfortunately for the second necklace the "Wish" part of the pendant was also put on backwards so you can't read it.

While I appreciate the replacement and have updated my review to reflect my findings with the second necklace, I feel it's just "okay."

I am a longtime Amazon Prime customer who enjoys writing reviews in my free time. I was appreciative to be given an opportunity to test and review this pendant and necklace at a discount for my honest and unbiased review. If you have any questions or comments about this product or my review, feel free to message me and I'll be glad to help!
summary: While a Nice Idea in Concept, This Pendant Is Just Okay

reviewText:
I knew that this shirt ran small when I ordered it. But really, it does fit QUITE small! I ordered a small, and it barely fit the four year old I bought it for, who is petite. My niece adored the shirt, though! The color was just as it looks, and the chalkboard flower on the shirt is sturdy and durable and downright adorable. We drew her name on it, and some doodles, and she was just pleased as punch that her name was on the shirt. The material is comfortable and tag isn't scratchy. I was able to use regular chalk and a chalkboard pen to play around with different designs and had no trouble erasing.

I purchased this shirt at a discount in exchange for trying it out and providing an impartial review.

I ordered this shirt for my 4 year old daughter, she usually wears a 4T/5T.  I ordered an XS, it fits her perfectly.  It is a fitted shirt, so its on the slimmer side.

She loves being able to write on her shirt, she's decorated the flower with the chalk that came with the shirt and with chalk markers.  I tried it with the markers and it worked well.  We wipe the flower with a baby wipe to clean it off and start over with the decorations.

The chalk that came with the shirt is extra bright, which is nice.

The material of the shirt is soft and high quality, the shirt itself is on the longer side, so it will go with leggings or bike shorts.  The underside of the flower is a little stiff but still soft.  Things on her shirt can bother my daughter but she didn't complain about this shirt, it was ok to wear.

I received this at a discount in exchange for my honest review.
I had to buy both dinosaur designs as my son refuses to wear anything else. Great idea, easy to design again and again!
summary: Great fun and good quality shirt!

reviewText: I like this shirt very much. Fits well and is good quality.

When I saw the Chalk Me Up! Chalkboard T-shirt, I thought it would be something my daughter would like. She was stoked when it came in. I was not sure about the size. She is a small 10, so I ordered the Large (said to fit size 10-12). It fit her perfectly, but I expect it would be too small if she was a size 12.

Decorating the shirt was fun. She decided she was going to make a scene with a single flower in the middle. We used the chalk that the shirt came with. We decided to lay the shirt down on a table when drawing (I would recommend this as it was the best way to keep the shirt still). Through regular wear, I anticipate the picture will fade throughout the day. The great thing is that I will be able to wash it and the fun will start all over again. I am curious if the liquid chalk pens would work on this shirt. we may have to get some and give it a try.

This was a great purchase for my daughter and I recommend it as a fun gift for kids.

I was able to purchase this item at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

I love this idea, and we love this shirt!  Included is a business card with instructions for use and washing on the back, as well as a box of 12 piece Crayola chalk in various colors.
Size:
It seemed like it as going to be small, and I got the Large (10-12Y), figuring that it would fit one of my kids.  I tried it on my oldest, who is 13, but of smaller build (think 25th%)- it fit her perfectly, both in the shoulder and sleeve area, and length.
 I tried it on my 7 year old as well, who is is the size of an average sized 7 year old (think 50th%). My 7 year old can wear it, but it is is a bit big in the shoulders, and quite long.  She'll get plenty of wear out of it.  It is a fitted shirt, and if it were not, it would be too big on her.  Because it is fitted, it does not look odd.
Writing surface:
We used the Crayola chalk that came with the shirt. The surface was smooth, and really fun to work with. The first photos which I will post, are pre-washing, and the latter ones are post-washing. Now I have a disclaimer:  the instructions on the shirt clearly state to wash and then tumble on low.  I forgot.  While this did not affect the size of the shirt- it's a really great quality- it DID affect the writing surface.  It was not as smooth as before.  I was still able to write on it, but it was not as smooth.  I think in future, to preserve the shirt, I will just hang it to dry, since I don't often have clothes that are dried on low.
While I in my frugality would probably not want to spend as much on a shirt that will be outgrown, I DO think it would make an awesome, and unique gift for someone, and therefore worth the purchase. It is certainly of a good quality, and a one of a kind product.

I purchased this shirt at a discount in exchange for my honest and fair review.
summary: One of a kind and fun!

reviewText:
My girls and I are having so much fun with this shirt.
The fit is as I expected, but I ordered a size up. Which I recommend doing. We got a size large and it fits my 10 year old, who normally wears a kids size 14/16. It fits a little snug but she was able to wear it all day, no complaints.
It also fits my 8 year old with some room to grow.
We love the ability to get creative and write, draw, and color whatever we want. I let my girls be the inventor the first times they wore it. My oldest daughter made pretty flower designs, my younger daughter was a little more creative to the point of not knowing what exactly she was creating,  but it still looked cute. They both received many comlpiments on how cool or pretty their shirt was.
I love the fact that it comes with its own pack of colored chalk, which can also be used on other chalkboard surfaces.
The possibilities are endless and so much fun.

reviewText: This t-shirt is so cool! I got it for my daughter to wear for her birthday party. When she saw the shirt and the chalk that came along with it, she was beyond excited!! She has had so much fun decorating it! I was wondering how it would work if you wanted to change the design or what would happen once it was washed, so I had her decorate it with the chalk, then I washed it. It came out as a perfectly new and fresh canvas for the fun to begin again!! So impressed with this product! It was just as easy to chalk on the petal portion of the t-shirt after it had been washed as it was to start with. I can see that this is going to become her favorite shirt. The quality is very nice- the t-shirt itself is soft and the shade of pink is very pretty and bright. The chalk surface is slightly elevated on the shirt but not enough that it feels big or bulky. Super fun idea, and I cannot wait to buy more to give as gifts!! I received a discount on this product in exchange for my honest review, and I am 100 percent glad I did. reviewText:
My kids love to design their own shirts and this chalkboard shirt has been the best find yet! My daughter loves to draw her own pictures on it and show off her creativity. The manufacturer's recommendation to go up a size when ordering was a helpful note. My daughter is slender 5yo and we got the size Medium. The shirt has a fitted cut so it hugs closer to her body than some other shirts.

We have already washed this shirt several times and the chalkboard portion is still going strong. No signs of cracking or peeling. I love that each time we wash & dry this shirt it comes out as perfect as when it first arrived.

The only drawback I have found is that the chalk wipes off the shirt quite easily. I first noticed it rubbing off on my daughter's hands while she was playing but also noticed it on our furniture and the clothing of people around her. If this is something that would bother you, you might want to skip this shirt.

Overall we are really enjoying this shirt. It is soft and a vivid shade of raspberry pink. The novelty of always having an original design on the shirt is continuing to keep my daughter's interest. Now my boys want one!

Disclaimer - I received this product at a discount. My opinions are freely given without any obligation.
summary: Great shirt to express unique creativity & style!

reviewText:
My daughter was impressed with this shirt and the idea behind it.  I wasn't so sure, being that chalk would rub off, lol.  We put it straight on my almost 9 year old and it fit her perfectly.  I asked her what we should draw on it and she decided on a cat.  I wasn't able to draw on it while she was wearing it, so she took it off and I laid it on our counter.  At first it was difficult to see the chalk.  I realized that since the chalk was brand new, it needed to "get started" first.  I went and used it on our chalk board a little and after that it wrote perfectly on the shirt.  I drew my best cat and off to school she went.  She thought the shirt was really cool and liked that we can draw a new thing every time she wears it.  I was correct that the chalk would rub off.  By the end of the day, when I picked her up from school, there was no longer any drawing left.  She did not care and the shirt still has a cute design, the daisy.  Over all this is a really awesome shirt!  We both liked it.  I loved that it came with a pack of chalk in vibrant fun colors!

reviewText: Lovely red color ... RFID blocking ... LOTS of room inside - even for a phone ... very well organized - lots of compartments ... zippered coin section ... supple feel ... straight stitching ... fabric lining ... slim design ... looks like it will last quite a while ... very reasonable price!

I ordered it in red and it feels good and looks good too, with lots of room, even for my cell phone!.
I trust Amazon's products so I hope it does what it's suppose to do and keep the hackers at bay.

Thanks Amazon!

I like this RFID protected women's clutch wallet. It seems to be made very well with straight seams and hardware that works.

Closed I measured it as 7 3/8" long x 3 3/4" wide x 1" at its thickest point.

It has 10 credit card slots (4 of them are in the side of one of the cash slots). It also has an ID slot that is covered with see-through plastic. There are 4 long slots that you can put cash, receipts, notes or whatever in. If your phone is slim enough, it'll probably fit in one of the slots.  Then there is a zippered compartment in the center of the wallet that will hold a small amount of change or a flash drive or a spare key.

The Amazon page says this is made of leather but it doesn't say what kind of leather. It has an attractive pebbled finish. There is a very strong odor to the wallet, even after it's been out of its box for a while.  I don't know whether it's the leather or a preservative for the leather or some other chemical but it's enough to give me a headache.

The wallet closes with a strong snap on the front.

It comes packaged in a black velvet "envelope" that then goes into an attractive black presentation box with Dante written in silver on the front.

I received this wallet in exchange for my honest review. I really like it - except for the strong odor.
summary: Ordered the bright red and it's quite a bit darker than expected

reviewText:
I have been using this wallet for almost two weeks and I like having so many compartments: 10 credit card slots, one ID Window, two currency pockets, one zippered pouch. I got the red color as my main purse is red and is a pretty good match in color.  Initially the credit card slots were very tight and it took some effort to pull out each credit cards but after about of week of daily use it got better as the leather stretched out.

Its size is 3.75" x 7.25" (a little smaller than Amazon description).
The id compartment is 3 5/8" long and 2 5/8" wide.  It fits both the drivers license and the passport card (which is tiny bit large than the driver's license).

Drivers license is 3 3/8" X 2 1/8"
Passport card is 3 1/2" x 2 1/4"

There are two aspects to consider about this wallet. First, how does it fit all items one wants to carry in the wallet. Second, is RFID protection worth paying extra for.

RFID
~~~~
When is RFID useful? There are three types of credit cards:
1) Cards that have only magnetic strip do not emit any kind of data for the thieves to steal. RFID protection is not needed.

2) RFID cards which are are identified by wavy lines on the card (see attached photo). These cards came into being a few years ago and has not became widely used. RFID chip cards produce radio waves which can be picked by thieves that are are a few feet away from the card and can be targets for electronic pick pockets. RFID protection is needed.

3) The new EMV chipped cards they are now a requirement and are common. EMV cards work either by being inserted into a check out terminal or by Near Field Communication (NFC). NFC radio signals degrade very quickly, they can only be transmitted within a very short distance measured in centimeters. This need for proximity makes the risk of electronic pick pockets extremely low. In addition, the data transmitted by the card is encrypted which further minimizing the risk. Whether RFID protection is needed is more of a personal preference rather than yes or no purely based on the technology.

So what is the bottom line? For the old fashioned magnetic strip cards RFID protection is not needed at all. If you have the old RFID type credit card, the RFID wallets are useful. For the EMV credit cards they are not really needed but could provide peace of mind for those who worry.

This wallet is provided by Dante for evaluation and review. I hope my review was helpful to figure it if the wallet is match for your needs.  RFID protection is not a key feature for me, but I like the way it looks and the number of compartments it has.

Ali Julia review
summary: It is nice to have so many compartments

reviewText:
Good price for these socks!  These socks are very comfortable and fit nicely.  The tops do not fall down while being active, the height of the upper part of the sock is nice.  Not too high where they rub or feel strange on my calves, just at the right spot.  They fit as expected.  The extra support in the heel and toe area was a benefit as well.  Gives a bit of extra cushion in those areas that take the weight of being on your feet.  I have worn these socks running and they did not rub against my shoes, no blistering.

The color choices were fun to decide which ones to order.  I like the blended color.  Let's be realistic sometimes we go through mud or other things that turn our white socks dirty & grungy looking.  The mixture of colors in these socks the mud stains would not show up.  It is nice a smaller size pack of these socks is offered so someone can try them before they purchase a larger pack.  I am considering purchasing a larger pack of these socks for some friends that enjoy outdoor activities as well so they can try them.  I think they will enjoy them as well and the price is decent.

I would absolutely recommend these cotton blend multi function socks. I did receive these socks at a discount price in exchange for my honest review. I received no compensation for my review and I gave my honest review of the product. I often shop on Amazon and rely heavily on reviews to purchase items. I appreciate people's honest reviews and I offer honest reviews as well.

reviewText: Something no one else explained: There is no way to order different sizes to make the perfect bikini out of these because the back isn't adjustable enough to make it work. In other words, the cups in the top are entirely too small if you order for the size around your rib cage and back, but if you order a larger size for larger cups it won't fit because the way it's made there is no way to make the adjustment in the back strap.  In any case no matter which size you buy you will have problems. I bought four different sizes and tried different size bottoms with different size tops to try and make one decent fitting bikini but no matter what I did, there was no way for it to work. All of the bottoms are way too big and fit weird in front and all of the tops are made for flat chested girls that are big around the ribs and back. Also there is no way to take out the hard cups that are built in which makes it impossible to look good over a chest that has actual boobs. I wasted my money on four swimsuits just to end up with nothing wearable, please don't make the same mistake. These are made for big women with no boobs that wouldn't wear something so revealing... which is something I find odd because most asian clothes makers make everything too small HA!

reviewText: My daughter loves

every 90s girl's dream.

The set of Gothic Jewelry by Gingerscoolstuff comes as a fifteen piece set.  You receive a ring, bracelet and necklace in each of the five colors.

Each piece is made of a stretchy plastic that is double looped in a double wired style, so it is two pieces of the material run together. Also,each ring, bracelet and necklace are closed off at one end with a tiny black bead with the other end looped through before the bead is sealed on.

The bracelet is small enough to fit my 5 year old and stretches large enough to fit an adult wrist.  The ring fits my child also and stretches large enough to fit my size 9 finger.  The necklace stretches large enough for me to wear on my head as a headband.  I did notice that once the necklace was stretched out, it did not go back down to the tiny shape that it was before I took it off the card it was attached to, but not so stretched out that it wasn't useable.

With the elasticity of the pieces of jewelry and the strength of the material, I anticipate these lasting for quite some time for my girls to play with and enjoy.  If you are looking for a birthday gift for a little girl, this would be great.  And with the large set, you also could use it as party favors for goodie bags. The product recommendations are for 6 years and older, so you need to take that into consideration due to it being a possible choking hazard, but my 5 year old has never been a child to put non-food items in her mouth and she played with them under supervision.

I did receive this product at a reduced rate for my honest and unbiased opinion based on my experience with the product.
summary: I anticipate these lasting for quite some time for my girls to play with and enjoy. If you are looking for a birthday gift ...

My first experience with Boxy was the very affordable, but very unattractive, cube-looking "Boxy Winder" as they called it, which was also marketed under other brand names.  It had an awful fake carbon fiber print front, with a large submarine bubble cover.  But, it was affordable, small, and able to stack with other Boxy Winders, so I wound up getting more, especially since it performed flawlessly at the most important task -- silently keeping my watch wound.

Since then, I see they have the "Fancy Brick" now, which is kind of an upgraded version of the original cube, plus this new series, the Castle Series, which I think is just about the best winder on the market and the fact that it's hundreds less than other winders that don't even look this good is just amazing, and my hat is off to Boxy on this winning design.

I did not buy it here, because it wasn't on Amazon yet, but seeing it here now, I wanted to leave a review for other folks looking for a good winder.

With a small collection of various Swiss automatics, I have bought a number of winders over the years, and always I'd rather spend less where possible, so I have more money for more watches!  But a winder has to do the job.  I've had some good luck with Heiden, Belocia, even Chiyoba, and of course I love my Wolf Winder, but to date this really about the best winder I've purchased, and the price is really stunning for what you get.

This is a hardwood, matte finish, beautiful piece of furniture, with a glass cover that glides down on soft touch hinges.  The interior is finished in black and the clean, modern design is incredibly attractive.  They aren't trying to fancy it up, just keeping it simple and streamlined, and the result that it looks far more expensive than what you paid, and avoids the "budget" look of inexpensive winders that try to save money with plastic lids, fake stitched leather and overly glossed veneer finishes.  So, if you are looking for a winder you can be proud to display, this is the one, and your watches look great shining out from the dark interior (which very effectively highlights your watches as the main attraction).

And, speaking of shining out -- this has LIGHTS!!!  Yup, two LED's inside light up your beautiful time pieces whenever it feels vibration, such as opening the cover.  And yes, you can turn those off, with a simple push of a button.

If there is any tiny drawback to this model, at all, it is probably that the controls are recessed into the front of the unit, and are a bit difficult to reach, for initial set up.  That's a very minor thing though, compared to everything that is so outstanding about this winder and it's not an area you need to access more than once anyway.

Movement is absolutely silent, the watch holding mechanism is simple but effective, with a very firm foam pillow that fits snugly into the cradle, holding your watch very secure.

Another great feature?  Like other Boxy winders, it always returns your watch to an upright position, meaning the twelve faces to the top, so after each winding cycle, both of your watches face upright.

With a four pin switch system, there are a ton of variations for turns per day, in whatever direction you choose, so this also scores big points for being suitable for just about any watch on earth.

Fit and finish certainly matches or even beats winders four or five times more expensive and it excels where it matters most, in keeping your watches steadily and quietly wound.  Such is why I really do think it's one of the best winders on the market right now, considering you can spend far less without any compromise in performance or in appearance for that matter.

I'm really impressed with this unit and will be buying a second one, once my collection expands.

Highly recommend!!!

reviewText: The style, fit and sizing of this are similar to the Ponte Tank Dress from American Apparel. The differences are that the straps are tighter and the dress is shorter. The fabric is also of a poorer quality and doesn't stretch like the AA dress, but it's still thick enough to be worn without a bra. The tags on it say Amanzoo Apparel (lol) and it's packaged to look like an AA product. I'd recommend sizing up in this if the AA dress is tight on you as it's not stretchy at all. I think it's a good dupe and for $15, worth it, but I'd definitely not pay more than $30 for it.

I received a copy in exchange for an unbiased review.

Not many watches quote Doskievski in the packing materials, but it serves to elevate the purpose behind this artistic time piece. (Or time-peace, if you enjoy the play on words). The artistic face design is a conversation starter, and I've received several compliments from random strangers. I'm normally not a fan of plastic bands, but the quality of the strap is better than I anticipated. I was also pleased to find that the case is heavy duty metal rather than plastic like many watches in this price range. It's kept perfect time since I set it, another refreshing change from other budget priced watches.

My only complaint is the dial mechanism is located at the top, rather than in the traditional 3 o'clock position. I've got fairly large hands, and it was a bit of a challenge setting it while the stem was pressed against the band. But as I said, it's kept excellent time since the initial setting, so that was only a momentary gripe. All in all a great bang for the buck for a unique budget oriented watch.
summary: A fun and functional conversation piece

Nope. This is the exact same "Active Basics" shirt that thirty sellers are offering under thirty different names, and it's thirty kinds of lousy. The Large fits like a 6-8 (a "regular" cut Small or a snug-fit Medium), the body is too short, the sleeves are too short, it is TINY. If you're under five feet tall and enjoy purchasing tops two sizes bigger than normal just to be able to get them over your shoulders, or you prefer your shirts to fit like sausage casing, then by all means, click "buy now." Otherwise, look elsewhere. If this were actually sized and cut in a reasonable manner, it would be a fine shirt. It's thin but not see-through (in black, anyway), fabric isn't scratchy, and the wrist and hem seams stretch well. If you're a size 10-12 or larger, though, avoid.
summary: Did I wander into the children's department by mistake?

Double prong replacement straps do not come equal. I bought another
one from ebay and the rubber composition is not the same.
You see, these kinds of thick rubber straps only become comfortable after
you boil them in water. After I boiled this Swigen band and the ebay band in water,
the Swigen became super flexible and soft, like a thick rubber band, whereas the ebay
one only became more rigid and uncomfortable. By the way, if you do this mod, I also recommend wrapping
it around a can so that the straps will conform better to the shape of your wrists.
Now, I have a really secure and comfortable replacement strap for my Traser watch.
summary: Comfortable and Durable... after a Quick Mod

reviewText:
Please note that I received this product free of charge for testing purposes and all opinions/experiences are my own. Do let me know if you have any questions!

You should know that I LOVE beanie hats. I do like it when they are not too tight or to loose.
This hat is a bit on a larger side, however, it's an easy fix. Wash on delicate/cold water cycle and dry it slightly for a little bit on delicate/easy care knits.

Alternatively, you can just wash it on delicate cycle and line dry. Then, all you need to do is fold up the ends once or twice and your hat  becomes a bit smaller-this would fit perfectly. I tried it.

I  really like the color and highly recommend it to everyone, 12-60 (and beyond). Light,  pastel (not neon!), neutral colors are always in style and work well with scarves/hats.  This particular color (light beige), goes with anything.

I came home one day, tired after work, didn't exactly look all that great, and haven't taken a shower either (just got into the house). Well, I put on the hat (even before I washed it), and my face immediately lightened up. I  felt better!

:=)

KEEP IN MIND:
If you have sensitive, itchy, scratchy, allergy-prone skin like mine, I suggest finding a good quality soft scarf (cotton/silk, etc.), to wear underneath the funnel. It actually looks great as a scarf and it's an interesting concept.

This is a very nice outfit, however, it's not suitable for cold weather.  I can tell you that because I have a soft cashmere beanie and I wore a scarf on top of it on very cold days.
THIS outfit, however, is perfect, for low-mid 50's, even if it's windy, because it looks great and covers your  head and ears!

Fifties is actually my favorite temperature and I'm going to be wearing this  hat/scarf outfit!!
This color brightens up darker coats/outfits and complements lighter coats/clothing.  The hat is fairly soft and feels great on  my head.

Thank  you for asking me to test this product and share my thoughts.
Super comfortable and absolutely adorable! For the price it is a great deal. I want to buy it in many colors!

I only have one caution with these belts:  The are sized larger than most belts. I had to return one because it was too long (the return process was excellent, by the way). I ordered the next size down and it is still almost too long, but I have one or two holes available before I have to punch my own. The quality of both belts I received was similarly excellent. I would gladly purchase again.
summary: Excellent quality. Sized a little long.

reviewText:
This review is for the Men's Leather Belt Made in Italy by Badichi in the color black.  I purchased the belt in the large size.  It fit as expected.  The belt is made of nice quality leather and looks great.  The belt is thick, but not too thick to still hold my leatherman case.

I would recommend this to anyone looking for really nice belt.

Disclaimer: I purchased this item at a discounted price or received this item for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.
summary: The belt is made of nice quality leather and looks great

reviewText: I got this belt for my husband as his is several years old. Men's Leather Belt Made in Italy by Badichi - Black, Large is a really nice belt. I purchased the large size for my husband as his waist is typically a 36. The belt can be comfortably worn on the inner hole with room if he needs to loosen the belt. The belt is thick and appears to be made out of quality leather. It isn't super soft which is ok because that means it will probably hold up well to daily use. My husband wears a belt everyday so that is good that it is quality and will last for him. The large belt size is for size 36 to 38 waist. I would say it runs a little large as my husband is a 36 and can wear it on the inner most hole on the belt. The suggestion was that it should be comfortable worn on the third hole of the belt, that is a little large for my husband. It also was suggested on the listing that you should buy bigger than your pant size which if I would have bought him a bigger size, we would have had to exchange it for a smaller size. I like that this belt has the ability to look nice with everything my husband wears without looking too fancy or not fancy enough. He wears it with his slacks for work and jeans on the weekends. I would definitely recommend this belt to others. It would make an excellent addition to your wardrobe or would make an excellent gift. I received a discount on this product in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

Love it. I'm a big Chevy fan. Fast delivery E-Z ordering. Very happy.

Thick and very wide, a bit pricey.  It feels like it hasn't processed as a soft belt but very stiff

The belt looks like and feels like my "purchased in Italy" belt, minus the little italy tag and my old one was thicker by almost half. I'd say the belt is a 4/5 in quality and after a few days steady wear I don't see those telltale leather imprints like you see on cheap belts.  1.5" is the width, fits fine with my dress pants and jeans equally.

Overall I'll say i'm impressed and likely purchase more in multiple colors after a few more months of use.

CON:
They do run larger (longer) than I needed. Purchased the 36-38" one and I really needed the 32-34" with room to spare. But, being a belt of better quality, you can just remove the buckle, trim the leather accordingly, and tada, new belt that fits fine.
summary: The belt looks like and feels like my "purchased in Italy" belt

Most of the time, I order a Large in women's tops as I am broad across my back. The measurement around the fullest part of my bust is around 39-40". This is the measurement you will need to know when ordering your size. If it fits around your bust properly, the rest will drape. This top looked way too baggy in the size Large so I ordered one in a size Medium. It fits perfectly. I love the high neckline and the cut in shoulders. The arm holes are perfect. The material is light weight enough to drape beautifully. I was afraid it was going to look like a tent but it doesn't. I am 5' 6" tall and a fairly fit 64 year old.  I generally like more fitted tops but this looks great with straight leg pants and I don't have to worry about any bulging around the back or around the waist. It is a very flattering cut for me but I will say that it would probably be best for taller women due to long length in the front. You will have to wear a bra with cut in straps if you don't want them to show.

This is great with leggings, just what I was hoping for when I ordered it. I'm 5'5" and it comes about mid thigh in the front and a little past my hips on the side. It's also really soft. Would buy again.

I didn't realize how handy the double zipper would be until I actually used it. It's nice to be able to have my phone on one side by itself and have my money and credit cards on the other side so that I don't have to fumble around one set of things to get to the other.
The faux leather has a nice feel to it.

The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because the zippers are a little on the flimsy side and don't feel like they'll last very long, so I'll have to be sure not to over-pack this clutch. I've had it for a couple of weeks now, and so far, it's done just fine.

reviewText: Well, it actually fits perfectly, which is shocking to me because people said it fit small..  I am 5'5" 140lbs. size 10-12 and ordered a Large. reviewText: This is a wonderful, unique purse, in which I have received many compliments on the flower design.  I wish I could give this bag 5 stars, but it's durability is in question:  after several hours of wear over the first two days I noticed that the leather piping was cracking and chipping.  This purse is not going to look gorgeous for even one season.  The little leather tongue that sits under the top clasp also is sticking out instead of lying down.  I have only worn the purse for a week as I write this review.  On the positive note, I adore the metal frame opening - it opens w i d e .  I can easily see everything inside.  The doctor bag shape is such a great design - everything is visible, not in some dark, black pit.  Also, the top fastener can be locked.  This is a huge bonus for extra security.  I keep the key in my pocket.  If the $200. price tag doesn't phase you, go ahead and buy it and enjoy it before the leather starts looking worn.
summary: Leather piping wears after first two hours of wear.

reviewText: Whether it's yoga or cardio, these are great. The wide waistband helps to hold them firmly in place without that annoying downward creep that happens when kicking my own butt during a workout. I like these leggings so much, I just ordered another pair.
The stitching is very itchy around the knees! :(  The pants are so thin they show cellulite.
Really good quality for the price pay.
Thick fabric and well made! Love these!

I ordered these leggings and was a little nervous about the fit. I am a curvalicious 5'5 woman and often find myself in between sizes, but I decided to buy an XL pair. These leggings fit like a dream and are VERY flattering! I wear them all the time to the gym and am going to have to order several more pairs because I love them so much! They wick sweat really well and have top band coverage for my luscious muffin top, so I don't have to worry when I'm running or working out at the gym. They also don't slide down and I swear they'll make anyone's booty look a-meh-zing! You should definitely buy yourself a pair (or twelve)!

Love Them!!
Fit great ! Look great!
I love them!

Absolutely LOVE these!!!!!! Do not have second thoughts about ordering as this is the most quality of work out pants that I have owned!
Size is true to fit...I wear a 14 and I ordered an XL...fit me like a glove. I've worked out in them and they've went through many washings and STILL look brand new!!!!! Plus...I love all the compliments I get on the style. Feel like a million bucks in them!
Love this product, it is just too big!  This is what happens when you have great workout wear.  Fitness and loss of needing larger sizes!
Great for running.
Love it.  Fits true to size.

reviewText: Material and color are nice.  It has two small pockets (one below each hip) that can accomodate keys or a phone. It is a good value for the price.  I'm a size 6-8 and ordered a M that is not sufficiently tight, but good enough that is not worth returning/exchanging.  I wore it this morning and it was fine.

Great product, love the side pockets. I find the crotch sags a bit so I keep pulling it up--my other tights of the same size don't do that, but maybe I've gained weight. I'll update it in a couple of months.

reviewText: These are so cute!  They fit like the expensive brands and look and feel just as nice! I have come across the problem of workout pants being too thick, not breathing well, and not moving naturally. That is not the case for these at all and I am ecstatic! You can't beat the price for what you get!!!  I will be ordering more from this brand. Very happy!

reviewText: Great quality. High waist, fits as expected. Thick no see through.
Love the detail and style

Both of my favorite leggings are from this brand. Ive tried Nike, Lulu lemon, and many others, but this brand is surprisingly up to par with them. Theyre pretty thick, no no major transparency problems here. The cute mesh cutouts are pretty flattering. Speaking of flattering, can we all just give a round of applause for the built in tummy band. You know when leggings go up with a panel over your tummy, and it just makes them look that much better, thats whats happening here.
summary: Both of my favorite leggings are from this brand

reviewText: I normally wear a size L and ordered a size L. Fits perfect!

Very comfortable and attractive. The fabric is fitted without being clingy and while not too thin, it is neither bulky or hot. I haven't worked out in them yet but I did wear them under a dress on a 13 hour flight and they were comfortable and practical. This my second pair of their capris. The other pair is a simple cotton and these are sportier, thicker and full synthetic but the quality and fit met the expectations raised by the other pair. I hadn't heard of the brand but they are now two in a row for quality, looks and comfort and officially my favorite for work out capris.

My very favorite workout pants are by RBX. I have wore them out!!
I received these yesterday so I haven't worn them, only tried them on. The fit is perfect!! I think I will love them :)
Love these pants!!! They fit great!
I just got these and they are so flattering! Fit perfect. Very true to size!! I have quite a booty and these fit great. My husband may not let me wear them to the gym because they look so good!

I had to return these. After reading the other reviews, I purchased a large, which I typically wear a medium. I should have stayed with my true size. And of course they were sold out of mediums when I went to purchase the correct size :(
The product itself is well-made, and looks as expected.
Love these!!! My go to running capris!! Fit perfect, true to size
Great quality and you can"t beat the awesome price...
These are a perfect replica of  more expensive brands that cost 3x as much. I always have a problem with legging/workout clothes being too long. These capris are a great length.

I bought a pair of these almost 2 years ago, and they have been my favorite, go-to leggings for working out, running errands, or lazing around the house. They are super comfortable, opaque, and breathable. I love the wider waistband that RBX uses, and the mesh on these is slightly see-through, but still modest and has held up great. I just purchased another pair via amazon after considering it for several months now. I didn't really want to pay the Amazon price because I bought my first pair in TJ Maxx or a similar store for like $10, but I eventually gave in because I can't find workout leggings that offer the same fit and comfort. For reference, I am 5'7", 160 lbs with thicker hips and thighs, and the medium is perfect.
summary: Comfortable, opaque, and hold up over time

reviewText: They were the best for ever'
Amazing product! Outstanding quality! Prompt delivery and courteous service!

I got a S and M. I am 5 foot 4 and weigh 140. I am a size 4 in Old Navy Jeans. The Small is great other than it is a little snug in the waist. The Mediums are too big in the waist and around the calf. They shrink a little with washing but stretch back out easily. Mediums are definitely more comfortable.
Look and fit great.

The size wasn't too small per se, however unlike most workout pants, the waist is not very "stretchy". Even though the material of the pants is flexible, there is stitching along the waist that restricts how much it can expand. I mean, I was barely stretching them over my thighs and heard stitching (from the waist) popping. So, I can see how some people found the medium size to be too small. For me, the pants fit perfectly otherwise and it didn't seem like there would be any issues with the rest of the seams (like along the cutouts) so to prevent having the waist be too loose, I'm just keeping the medium and hoping it holds up! I haven't yet washed these so will see how they hold up over time.
summary: Super Cool Design; Inflexible Waist Stitching

reviewText: They are true to fit and are so comfortable! Definitely worth the money!

I wanted to love these but unfortunately I don't. I love how the mesh goes up high on the thigh and it does a good job of being "mesh" without too revealing. But the thin material plus some weird fitting around "that" area made me way too self-conscious to wear in public. The seams just fit... Right up in there, if you get my drift.  I wear high waisted workout capris constantly and have never had this problem (I put on another pair to check).  Just these. So order but beware of the camel toe seam!  Also they run a little big.
Love these. Fit is great (I didn't realize when I purchased it is high waist - it is high waist but it means it won't roll down when you are active). I get compliments and it slims your legs.

reviewText: Love it
very comfortable
Runs kinda large but love RBX pants

The fabric is a bit more substantial than other brands I've tried so they look smoother, yet they are still cool and comfy. They're a nice cheerful color to brighten my day when working out.

reviewText: These are advertised as compression but they aren't. The waist is fitted but I needed them to fit better all over  due to a sports groin strain. They sadly won't do the job. Because they were only $12-13 I just kept them. Wasn't worth the time, effort or gas to return them.
Great fit up top, a tad baggy around knees .

I wear xlarge in other brands and i have problem.  I ordered 2 of the RBX leggings and they run very small. i would say the xlarge are really a medium. Im not saying they are not good, im saying they run very small.

reviewText: Really nice, perfect thickness, great color. The back of the calves has a see-thru netting design you couldn't really see from the advertised pic, but it's fine.

I love these!

I was kind of in between sizes so that was tricky, but overall the quality and fit of these pants is AMAZING.

I'm 5'8", 143 lb., 27" waist and 39" hips. The MEDIUM was a little too tight for my liking and I felt like I'd rip something if I were to stretch them too much so I returned for a LARGE. The waist is a tiny bit too loose, but thighs fit perfectly. The high waist is lovely and sits just at my belly button.

I bought the CHARCOAL HEATHER grey with black mesh details and they are 100% NOT SEE THROUGH which was the main reason for my buying them since I squat and deadlift and have had problems "exposing myself" through other leggings in the past!

I needed them for a running costume and they're exactly what I wanted. The price wasn't bad either.  Nice fabric. The waist band is wide cut but I can notice the narrow elastic along the top, which I don't notice in my other running tights.  They look like they'll hold up OK. I would try this brand again, but I'd like to try a pair in my Medium size so I have something to compare.
Fit great, they look great, love them!

perfect fit and great performance capris pant. I will be buying more RBX pants!

reviewText:
I REALLY like these. I am hourglass shaped so I like to keep my waist defined, especially when it means I can gloss right over the love-handle territory. Whether running or capture the flag or yoga, I'm always pulling up work out pants, but these stayed up really well!

I like the venting/mesh in the back, too. These were originally purchased for a wonder woman costume but now I'm obsessed and have ordered another pair. (And maybe another after that, though I wish they had more colors...)

I know my measurements (40 hips, 30 waist or so) I'm 5'7" and 150 lbs. Great fit. Use the size guide!
Love these pants! The fit is great, the mesh looks cute, and they don't ride down during any type of workout.

These are my favorite workout leggings. I absolutely LOVE that they stay in place and the bottoms don't ride up your calves. That being said, I ordered ocean blue and pink rose colors but they are 110% turquoise and HOT pink. Nothing muted or subtle about the colors. Based on the price point and performance, I will keep these but I do wish the colors were true to their name and appearance online.

reviewText: Gift to a 5'11"/190lbs long waisted gal.  The Large fit great, no problems with calves fitting (but can see why maybe loose on skinny calves).  Loves higher waist as she's long waisted, and how they make her look.  Hasn't worked out in them yet - will update!
Great leggings.
These are very comfortable.  I love the high waist, it keeps the belly in check.  Lol

I love these pants so much. I am going to buy a few more pair. They are truly high-waisted and the top doesn't roll down while I'm working out. Any woman with a little tummy knows this is almost impossible to find. The compression isn't tight or uncomfortable, it makes me feel more confidant. One of my pet peeves with workout pants is that when you put them on the fabric gets shiny and sometimes almost see-through. These pants have a nice thick material and that doesn't  happen at all, not one bit. Hips 47", XL fits perfectly.
The pants are a polyester/spandex blend so I recommend skipping the dryer sheets as it can cause a buildup that prevents them from getting all the way clean. I have had mine for a few months. I wear and wash them at least once a week and they have held up beautifully.
Very Comfortable.  Slightly large meaning that the leg gets a bit baggy at the bottom.  Not bad enough to make a difference.  I've ordered 2 more!!!
Love these! Very slimming and not too compressing.
Great fit, great looking. Fits my ample thighs and long waist.

My only complaint is that the black "netting/mesh" part is somewhat scratchy which is the only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5. I would order another pair so I guess it doesn't bother me that much!

reviewText: Had these for a couple months now and I love them! Comfy, cute and cannot beat the price. RBX is on track to become my favorite brand for the price.

Just started working out after 4 years. These are very comfortable. I actually wore them all day yesterday running errands. They make my butt look nice and round. It is made of good quality and I don't have to worry about rips or holes. I would definitely purchase again.

reviewText: Well, at first I thought I liked them - and I did.  But after 3 washings (gentle cycle/warm water and line dry), the mesh inserts around calves started fraying at the hem, and while wearing them yesterday, I noticed a tiny tear in the rear-end seam!  Thank God I was working out in a private area of the gym.  I was surprised to see this and SO disappointed in RBX as my other RBX pants have been great.  They made their new home in the trash.
Love fit and feel of these. Aren't see through at the bum when bending over in the gym. High waisted is nice. Doesn't move/ fall down when doing high intensity workouts
summary: Love fit and feel of these

reviewText: I love these compression leggings, especially for the price! I'm not usually one to wear leggings because I have a lot of 'junk in the trunk' but these don't look bad on me, and they're very comfortable to run in. The high waist also gives additional lower back support which is nice.  My only complaints are they get a little see-through in the back after several washings and the zipper for the back pouch is flimsy and doesn't like to zip sometimes. I usually just zip it slowly and guide the zipper with my fingers, and I don't put too much in the pouch and it works fine. Also, I bought 2 pairs of the black leggings so they're just mildly see-through in the back, which isn't noticeable as long as you don't wear underwear with a print on them. Order a size smaller than usual, I'm 5'6' and 175 lbs right now and the medium fits me perfect.
summary: Great compression leggings for the price!

reviewText: Great workout leggings. They are very comfortable and stylish, can't beat the price. I just ordered another pair!

Love these workout pants. They fit as expected - good level of compression and not see through as many can be. I have them in heather grey and will be ordering black when they are in stock. The mesh insert is cute although be warned it is not stretchy so some may not like that- personally not an issue for me. Great product at a reasonable price!

I like the design and color. But can't tell how effective it is as compression pants. It was extremely loose everywhere. To the point of being baggy and having extra fabric hanging. Unfortunately, the black see through netting magnifies the poor fit as it is not as stretchable. Not even close to a fitting cut; much less compression. The fabric also felt somewhat warm in a tropical climate even with air-conditioning. Pity...
summary: Nice to look at but not nice when worn... no compression... too large.

reviewText: I honestly was pretty disappointed in these pants when they arrived. They aren't the worst ever, so I didn't bother going through the process of returning them. I just thought they would be better because of all the 4 and 5 star reviews. The first thing I have a problem with is the color. It looks like a pretty, light blue color in the picture, but in reality it is more like the bright turquoise. I noticed at my school that some of the health care students had uniforms the exact same color. It just isn't a cute color, especially for workout pants. The second thing is the mesh part of the pants is really loose, so the fit is weird, and it also looks strange on my crotch the way it folds over. They aren't horrible, so I will be wearing them to work out in, but I was planning to be able to wear them around too, and I am pretty disappointed that they were not as cute as I expected.
summary: I honestly was pretty disappointed in these pants when they arrived

They looked small when I opened the package and I worried a bit due to that, but with a bit of shimmying, they actually fit like a particularly form fitting glove. The color is vivid and true to the photo. The only reason I bumped the rating down to a four, aside from the sliiightly small size, was that the seams around the color blocked areas on the shins and calves are SUPER irritating and itchy. I may just be extra sensitive, though I've never had this issue, but I really find the seams to be extremely annoying, almost to the point of being unable to wear them. I love the way they look at fit, so I'm going to try to throw some lining on the seams so I can actually wear them while working out!
summary: Super cute, but the seams are itchy!
